fwatlasbc 0.0.1.9001
  • Reference
  • Changelog

    Add River Meters to Blue Line Key

    fwa_add_rms_to_blk.Rd

    Adds distances (rm) and spatial coordinates (geometry) of regularly spaced points along blue line key (blk). All distances which are in meters are from the river mouth.

    fwa_add_rms_to_blk(
  x,
  interval = 1000,
  start = 0,
  end = Inf,
  epsg = getOption("fwa.epsg", 3005)
)

    Arguments

    x

    A data frame with integer column blk.
    interval

    A whole numeric of the distance between points.
    start

    A whole numeric of the start distance.
    end

    An integer of the end distance.
    epsg

    A positive whole number of EPSG projection for the coordinates.

    Value

    An sf tibble with the columns of x plus integer column rm and sf column geometry.

    See also

    Other rm: fwa_add_rm_to_lon_lat(), fwa_snap_rm_to_point()

    Examples

    fwa_add_rms_to_blk(data.frame(blk = 356308001))
#> Simple feature collection with 20 features and 3 fields
#> Geometry type: POINT
#> Dimension:     XY
#> Bounding box:  xmin: 1290725 ymin: 464161.2 xmax: 1301656 ymax: 469483.5
#> Projected CRS: NAD83 / BC Albers
#> # A tibble: 20 × 4
#>          blk    rm elevation           geometry
#>        <dbl> <int>     <dbl>        <POINT [m]>
#>  1 356308001     0      9.63 (1290725 469483.5)
#>  2 356308001  1000     10.1  (1291542 469173.9)
#>  3 356308001  2000      7.5  (1292439 468922.9)
#>  4 356308001  3000      9.69 (1292909 468665.1)
#>  5 356308001  4000      9.78 (1293268 467977.4)
#>  6 356308001  5000      9.78 (1293158 467231.2)
#>  7 356308001  6000      9.78 (1293794 467668.3)
#>  8 356308001  7000      9.78 (1294079 467938.4)
#>  9 356308001  8000     10    (1294497 468239.5)
#> 10 356308001  9000     10.5  (1294708 468081.9)
#> 11 356308001 10000     10.5  (1295576 467912.1)
#> 12 356308001 11000     10.5  (1296011 467111.8)
#> 13 356308001 12000     10.5  (1296414 466358.5)
#> 14 356308001 13000     10.5  (1297305 465976.3)
#> 15 356308001 14000     10.5  (1298145 465435.2)
#> 16 356308001 15000     10.5  (1298990 464903.5)
#> 17 356308001 16000     11.5  (1299886 465109.3)
#> 18 356308001 17000     48.0  (1300649 465508.7)
#> 19 356308001 18000    161.   (1301136 464758.4)
#> 20 356308001 19000    210.   (1301656 464161.2)
